news_header: Almost 1.8 million farmed and captive birds have been culled in the UK due to avian flu outbreaks. The government has mandated that bird-keepers in several counties house their flocks indoors.
news_original_title: Avian flu spread sees 1.8 million farmed birds culled
news_text: While the risk to humans remains low, there are significant concerns about the mental health of farmers affected by the culling. Biosecurity measures are in place, and compensation will be provided to farmers for healthy birds culled to control the disease.
